channel.title: Player Healing - Please help

item.title: Player Healing - Please help
item.dc:creator: @austinsobes austinsobes
item.description:
@austinsobes wrote:

I edited by appendHP() method. I’ve yet to test it. But I’m using a 508 source, so I have no client.java. I’m going to just mess around in Player.Java until I get it. If this works, thank you for the help.

EDIT
Well, It’s been over a minute. And my health hasn’t reached past 112. So thank you! it worked! I did have to do a small bit of rewriting the updateHP() method but it stopped the overhealing! thanks a bunch!

EDIT
I spoke too soon… :’(

Read full topic

item.title: Player Healing - Please help
item.dc:creator: @austinsobes austinsobes
item.description:
@austinsobes wrote:

I’m using DemonWars server and Client. And whenever a player logs into the server they health regeneration never stops. When you get hit you slowly regenerate your health one by one over time, but it doesn’t stop at your level. If you have level 99HP you still regenerate health past that non-stop. How do I set a limit to this? I know the code would look something like this.

if (!(skillLevel[3] + 1 > skillLevel[3]))
//heal
//else
//don't heal

But I can’t find the Health Regeneration. Can anybody help please?

The code I used above was improvised code I took from appendHit(). Since the regeneration is healing about 1 every 15-30 seconds I assumed it was like a ++ modifier.

Read full topic
